utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Oh! Hey, Rach!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Hi! Hey, Happy Valentine’s Day!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Oh, you, too.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Hey, so, uh, how’s it going living over at Ross’?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: It’s good. Except he makes us watch the Discovery Channel all day long. Did you know that something really boring happened to someone really ugly in the Middle Ages? Oh, thank you. I’ll see you guys later.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Okay.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Bye.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: There’s one lucky to-go cup of coffee.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Honey, I wish you would get over her. I hate seeing you like this. Is there anything I can do for you? Do you want to look down my top?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Thanks. But maybe later.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Oh, Gunther, can I get a scone?

utterance.speaker: Gunther
utterance.content: You want anything?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: You know what I want? I want a lot of things! I want to be with the woman I love on Valentine’s Day! And I want her to love me back! And I want just one moment of relief from the gut-wrenching pain of knowing that that’s never going to happen!

utterance.speaker: Gunther
utterance.content: We have red bagels.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Oh, okay.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: So, how does Mona feel about you and Rachel living together?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Oh, I’m actually on my way to tell her right now. Yeah, she’s been away all week visiting her parents, but she’ll be cool. I mean, she’s been so supportive. She-she even got the baby a tiny T-shirt that says, ‘Fossils are my friends.’

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Ugh. Come on, Mona, don’t kiss ass.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Uh, I’m going to take off.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: All right. Oh! Shoot! Oh shoot! Uh, Rachel wanted to see this tape!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: What is it?

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: It’s a video of my friend giving birth. Could you just bring it back to your apartment?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: All right. ‘Candy and Cookie?’

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Yeah. Candy’s the mother, Cookie’s the daughter. The father’s also Cookie. Why am I friends with these people?

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Phoebe, c’mere. I want to show you something in the bathroom.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Oh, Monica, grow up!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Hey, what’s behind your back?

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Nothing. Just something I want to get Phoebe’s opinion on for Valentine’s Day.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: You don’t want my opinion?

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Not really.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Come on, I’m your older brother, ask me!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: All right, big brother. Which of these do you think would make your little sister look hotter, so your best friend would want to do her?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: The red one.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Hey. Look, I know you’ve been really depressed lately, so I brought someone over to cheer you up. Right outside this door is a real, live, furry playmate.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: No, I’m not sleeping with your friend Jane again.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: He-hee!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Hey! A dog! Hi! Who, you got to admit, looks a lot like Jane.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: This is the happiest dog in the world. I borrowed him from my friend Wendy. Now, you can only keep him until he cheers you up. And he will cheer you up!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Thanks so much, Pheebs! We are going to have so much fun, yes we are! Oh! Not that kind of fun.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Happy Valentine’s!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Okay! I’ll be right out. I’m slipping into something a little less comfortable, and a little more slutty.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: ‘Candy and Cookie’. ‘Candy and Cookie?’ Monica got me porn?! Girl-on-girl porn?! She really must love me!!

utterance.speaker: Man on TV
utterance.content: Yeah, just relax.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: I love you, St. Valentine.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Woah, woah, that’s not pretty!

utterance.speaker: Man on TV
utterance.content: Now, push!

utterance.speaker: Woman on TV
utterance.content: Ow! Ow! Ooh! That hurts!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Worst porn ever! Worst porn ever!

utterance.speaker: Woman on TV
utterance.content: Ohhh! Make it stop!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: I am trying!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Get the ball, ready? Get the ball, get the ball! Well, you’re cute, but you’re not too smart!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Did I just throw this?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Hi.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Hi.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: I accidentally packed these with my stuff. Who is this?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Oh, that’s, uh, that’s Phoebe’s friend’s dog. I don’t know what his real name is, but I call him Mozzarella.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Oh, well, you are so cute! I wish I could play with you more, but I’ve got to go to work! I hope I stop talking like this before my marketing meeting, yes I do. Yes I do. Bye-bye, Joey. Oh, I seriously can’t stop it.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: C’mere. Hey. C’mere. That’s Rachel. She’s the one who used to live here. Might as well be honest with you—we love her. But we can’t have her. I really miss her. Well, hey, you understand, right? You’re a guy. Well, you used to be.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: So what do you think?

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: I’ve still got it!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Why did you get me this?

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: What is it?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: It’s yelling…bleeding…dilating. Oh, the dilating…

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Is this the video of the baby being born? Sweetie, this is Phoebe’s. Why were you even watching it?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: I thought…maybe…you got me porn for Valentine’s Day.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Chandler, if you thought I was going to get you porn for Valentine’s Day… you were right! Apparently, it’s about a young girl who moves to the big city, you know, in search of stardom, but ends up having sex with a lot of guys! Yeah, it got four starts! Oh, wait a minute. Those aren’t stars. Anyway, you want to take a look?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Well, I’m not really in a sexy mood right now.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Honey, what’s going on?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Well, remember the first time we saw Jaws?

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Mm-hmm.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: How long it took to go back in the water?

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Chandler, we can’t let this tape wreck Valentine’s Day!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: You don’t know. You didn’t see it.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Child-birth, it’s a natural thing! It’s beautiful.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Oh, beautiful? Really? Beautiful? You think this is beautiful?

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Oh! Oh, my God! No wonder my mother hates me!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: See, honey, there’s—

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Don’t touch me!

utterance.speaker: Mona
utterance.content: Hi!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Hey! So, how was Atlantic City?

utterance.speaker: Mona
utterance.content: Good.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Yeah?

utterance.speaker: Mona
utterance.content: I brought you back a present.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Wha—? Oh, come on. You didn’t have to—saltwater taffy?! Thanks! This is interesting. You know, most people think this is made with sea water, but it’s actually made with, uh, salted fresh water. That’s not interesting.

utterance.speaker: Mona
utterance.content: I think it’s interesting.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: I do too! I missed you!

utterance.speaker: Mona
utterance.content: I missed you, too! So, how was your week?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Oh, it was good! It was good. Actually, the baby started kicking!

utterance.speaker: Mona
utterance.content: How exciting!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Yeah! I know! It was. Oh… the only sad thing is I wasn’t around when it happened for the first time.

utterance.speaker: Mona
utterance.content: Oh no.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Yeah, I’m missing out on all this other stuff, too. So, Joey suggested Rachel move in with me.

utterance.speaker: Mona
utterance.content: Yeah right!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: Mona
utterance.content: Joey cracks me up! It’s like, ‘Yeah, why don’t you have your ex-wife move in with you? That wouldn’t be awkward at all!’

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Huh…uh-huh.

utterance.speaker: Mona
utterance.content: Huh, could you imagine. I go away for a few days, and come back, and my boyfriend is living with some woman he got pregnant!

utterance.speaker: Mona
utterance.content: So, what’d you tell him?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Just a second!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: How could you not tell Mona that Rachel is living with you?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: I don’t know, she seemed to think it was such a crazy idea! Um, plus, she, uh, she got me taffy!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Taffy, really? I’ve never had any.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Ever?!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Well, I think my mother was too busy planning her suicide to provide saltwater treats. Thank you! So what, you’re just never going to tell her?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Oh, no, no, no, I will! I just want to butter her up, first! You know, I’m going to take her to an amazing Valentine’s dinner. Do all this romantic stuff, and then, just when she thinks I’m the best boyfriend in the world, then I’m going to tell her that my pregnant ex-girlfriend is living with me.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: If I haven’t said it before: she’s a lucky, lucky lady! So, where are you going to—what the mother of crap is up with this stuff? Oh, God. Is it gum, is it food? What’s the deal? Oh, it’s nice! May I try a pink one?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: So, between her and me being friends, and her history with Ross, it just isn’t going to happen. It would be like you falling in love with a cat.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Hey!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Hey.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Hey, buddy. How’s my favorite dog, huh? How’s my favorite dog? You’re subdued. Did you give him a beer?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: No.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Will you excuse us, we need to talk for a moment.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Yeah, sure. Go ahead. Oh, me, right!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: He’s miserable! What happened to him?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Nothing. We just talked about stuff.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: What stuff?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Rachel stuff.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Oh…Joey, you bummed him out! This was the happiest dog in the world, and he spends half a day with you, and look at him!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: He’s breathing!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Okay, I’m going to take him back to Wendy’s.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: No, no, no, no! He’s fine! Look, look, look! Here’s your ball! Get your ball! Get your ball! Get your ball! My God, what have I done to you, huh? I broke the dog! Pheebs, I broke the dog!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Well, I’m, uh, going to pick up Mona. What have you got going tonight?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Oh, I’ve got big Valentine’s plans! I’ve got my Chinese food on the way, and the rest of your saltwater taffy!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Y’know, it’s interesting! Most people think that’s made with seawater, when in fact—

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Ross, we actually watched the documentary together.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Ooh! My Chinese food! Let me get my cash!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Mona? What are—hi! What are you doing here? I’m, um, supposed to pick you up!

utterance.speaker: Mona
utterance.content: Change of plans, I made you a special Valentine’s dinner! Surprise!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Ayyyayyyy!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Oh, hey, Mona!

utterance.speaker: Mona
utterance.content: Hi! Hi. Hi, Rachel! What’s she doing here?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: I have no idea!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: I’ll be watching TV if anybody needs me.

utterance.speaker: Mona
utterance.content: Seriously, what is she doing?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Uh…lately, she just likes hanging out here.

utterance.speaker: Mona
utterance.content: Why?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: I think she’s lonely.

utterance.speaker: Mona
utterance.content: Okay, but it’s Valentine’s Day!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: I know.

utterance.speaker: Mona
utterance.content: Can’t we just ask her to go?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: No, no. She’s way to emotional. And by emotional I mean crazy.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: I’m not here! That’s just my Chinese food!

utterance.speaker: Mona
utterance.content: Oh, my God! She has food delivered here?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Mm-hmm. She’s—she’s emotional, but, but ballsy.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: You know what I’m going to do? I’m going to get in my sweats, and eat this in bed!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: And you thought she was going to be in our way! So, why don’t you, uh, open the champagne, and I’ll be right back. I’ve got a surprise for you.

utterance.speaker: Mona
utterance.content: You got another ex-wife back there?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Please start drinking!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: I’m just going to grab the phone.

utterance.speaker: Mona
utterance.content: Oh, Rachel! Wait! Hey, I hope you don’t take this the wrong way, but, but, um… what are you doing?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Oh, I’m sorry! Do you need the phone?

utterance.speaker: Mona
utterance.content: No, no. Listen, Ross is too nice to say anything, but this is his apartment, and, and, we gotta have some boundaries, so why don’t you go back to your place and give us some privacy?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: But, but, Mona, I live here.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Happy Valentine’s Day! …Or something to remember me by.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: How long has it been this time?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: 90 seconds.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: That’s better. 90 seconds is a long time not to think about it…except all I did was think about it.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: You know, it haunts me? Up ‘til now, the worst thing I ever saw, was my father doing tequila shots off the naked houseboy. After this, I would gladly make that my screensaver!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Okay, well, we have to get past this! Why don’t we get rid of the tape and pretend it never existed?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: I can do that.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Okay.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Okay. Now all we’ve got to do is get rid of this chair.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Oh, thank God!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Oh, I know!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Come in!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Hi! I’m so sorry to barge in on your Valentine’s, but I had to get away from all the yelling. Mona is dumping Ross.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Oh, my God.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Poor Ross.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Oh, great. We have to watch him do yoga in his underwear, but for this he closes the drapes!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Rach, you know that birthing tape you wanted to see? It’s here.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Oh, and we should warn you, before you watch it: don’t watch it.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Why? You saw it? Is it scary?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Well, let’s just say it’s ironic how footage of someone being born can make you want to kill yourself.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Well, now, wait. Now I’m all freaked out. Come on, you guys will watch it with me.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: No, but I will leave a sweater that smells like me right next to you!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: C’mon, seriously, you guys, you’re not going to make me watch this alone!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: She’s right…of course not. Honey, get the tape.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: This reminds me of a very specific part of the tape. Okay, here we go.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Okay. Ooh, my! Woah! Why is that baby torturing that woman?!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Why have I seen this thing three times?!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: It’s…still beautiful.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Uh! It’s horrible!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: I know! I know, I’m so sorry for you!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Oh, my God!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Wait, you guys, look!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: What? Did her ass explode?!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: No, the baby’s out! Look, look!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Oh, look at those little fingers and toes!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: And look how happy the mom is now!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Oh…Rach!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Oh, screw you guys, you don’t have to do it!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Hey, hey, man!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Hey, what’s up?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Uh…Mona just dumped me.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Oh, man, I’m sorry. Why?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Well, with everything that’s been going on lately, I haven’t exactly been the perfect boyfriend. You know, I, uh, I didn’t tell her I got Rachel pregnant. I gave her a key to my apartment, and then had the locks changed! And then I lied to her about Rachel moving in with me. In a way, I actually judge her for not breaking up with me sooner, you know?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Still, that really sucks, man. Especially on Valentine’s Day.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Yeah. Wait a minute. What are you doing here? Joey Tribbiani without a date on Valentine’s Day? What’s going on, huh? Girl trouble?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Sort of.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Really?!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: You don’t have to seem so happy about it.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Oh, sorry. Well, look, maybe I can help you with it.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Oh, I…I d—

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Hey, whatever it is, I am sure it has happened to me. Y’know, actually once—once I got dumped during sex.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Anyway, so, uh, so what is it?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Forget about it. It’s no big deal.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: C’mon! Joey! What is it?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: It’s nothing.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Hey, hey, it’s me. Why can’t you tell me?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Okay, uh…sit down. Um… there’s this woman that I like. A lot. But, uh…it can’t happen.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: She’s not a Tribbiani?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: No!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: I knew it. So, is she someone from work?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Yes.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Well, uh, does she like you?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Sometimes I think maybe she could. But it doesn’t matter, because I can’t do anything about it.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Why not?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Well, it’s complicated. She’s with this other guy. For a long time. Someone from work, too. And I could never do that to the guy, because we’re really good friends.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: So, uh, this guy, she used to go out with, is, uh… is he still in love with her?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: No. I don’t think so.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Okay. Um… is he a good guy?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Yeah, he’s the best.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Then talk to him! He might be fine with it.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Oh, I don’t know.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Joey, it’s worth finding out. I mean, if you really like her.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: I do! So much! I can’t stop thinking about her! I can’t sleep, I—

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Okay, Joey, you know what? You have to go for it. How often does this happen to you, huh? You owe it to yourself.

utterance.speaker: Gunther
utterance.content: Here’s your warm milk.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: I’m going to…uh…I’m going to, um, put the bourbon in it at home.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Oh, yeah.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Anyway… seriously, uh…just…just talk to the guy, okay? And tell me how it goes.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: It’s Rachel.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: You’re going to have a baby, and you need to be prepared. Now, you’re going to make yourself watch the whole thing. Just do it!

utterance.speaker: Woman on TV
utterance.content: I came to the big city to become a star! I’ll do…anything to make that happen!

utterance.speaker: Man on TV
utterance.content: Anything?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Hmm…maybe it starts with how she gets pregnant.
